Author: orkestrels
Text: hey, it's okay. recovery is not a linear journey and momentary lapses or even straightforward relapse is common for a reason; it's hard, especially when so often it seems like the only comfort or resort you have. i recently relapsed after years of not purging, but every day is a new day and it's important to forgive yourself for these things. you had the will to try to recover before, and now with that learning experience, you can keep on recovering now. what's important is that you don't beat yourself up anymore and realize that you're only human, and to be proud that you have the willpower to recover and you had the strength to be purge-free for years. i believe in you and you will be okay, even if it's hard sometimes. this lapse is not reflective of you at all, and nothing is ruined just because of this.
